history.content:
You can only backdate when it is graduate class, not upper-division class.

"Berkeley undergraduates who take graduate course work during their last undergraduate semester may petition to backdate graduate standing in order to receive graduate credit for that course work. Graduate standing may be backdated for only one course, and students may petition for credit only for course work that was not previously used to satisfy requirements for another degree and/or the honors program at Berkeley or at any other institution."

--

As noted in some of the threads here, this is incorrect. I believe that upper div classes can be backdated for breadth, as long as it is not used for your undergrad degree. the language above stating "graduate course work" technically includes the upper divs for breadth, but this needs to be confirmed by an official advisor.

You can only backdate when it is graduate class, not upper-division class.

"Berkeley undergraduates who take graduate course work during their last undergraduate semester may petition to backdate graduate standing in order to receive graduate credit for that course work. Graduate standing may be backdated for only one course, and students may petition for credit only for course work that was not previously used to satisfy requirements for another degree and/or the honors program at Berkeley or at any other institution."

children.subject: They aren't the same class because the 289 and 200 have final research projects that the undergraduate versions do not
I'm almost certain you can't backdate mezzanine classes CS 189/Data 100 if you took them as an undergrad, because you took the undergrad version, not the grad version.
does anyone know how this works for classes like cs189/289a or data c100/200 which are the same class?
@Anon Poet this post @13961_f1 suggests that it is indeed possible to backdate breadth courses

You can also e-mail gradadmissions@eecs.berkeley.edu. I believe that Glenna Anton monitors that alias, and she can answer your question. I could look it up, since I used to know the answer, but I don't want to tell you the wrong thing.
I emailed Michael Sun about this a week ago but haven't gotten a response yet.

history.content: You can talk to Michael Sun about this in the fall. As in the quote from Anon. Poet, the class would need to be one that you did not use for your bachelor's degree in order for you to use it for your M.S.
I took an upperdiv breadth class last semester, when is the deadline to backdate and where is the form to do so?
history.subject: Backdating for 5th Year Master's
